articles.title: Mahakumbh Stampede Update: Major Developments Following Massive Chaos at Mahakumbh | ABP News
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: After the stampede at the Mahakumbh in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, the Akhada Parishad has decided to cancel the Amrit Snan (divine bath) scheduled for Mouni Amavasya. This announcement was made by the President of the Akhada Parishad, Ravindra Puri. He confirmed that following the chaotic incident at the Mahakumbh today, the Akhadas have completely called off the Amrit Snan for Mouni Amavasya. No Akhada will perform the divine bath today, and all processions have been called back to their camps. In an exclusive conversation with ABP News, Mahant Ravindra Puri expressed that it was a grand festival, but due to unforeseen circumstances, they were unable to perform the bath as planned. This major event was set to occur once in 140 years.

articles.title: Kumbh: Wife Takes Husband Hostage, Says - "Don't Want Him To Run Away" | ABP Live
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: As the time for the holy bath approaches, the crowd at the Maha Kumbh is increasing once again. Devotees attending the fair are concerned about the safety of their belongings and the possibility of losing their relatives in the massive gathering. The 'Lost and Found' center has been actively reuniting thousands of people with their families every day. While the center remains highly efficient this year, visitors are also taking their own precautions. Many have been seen tying their family members together with a rope to ensure they stay together. Amid this, a woman‚Äôs unique way of keeping her husband safe from the crowd has gone viral. The video of her unconventional approach has left people amused, with many unable to hold back their laughter.

articles.title: X‚Äôs payments app will be available later this year
creator: Karissa Bell
articles.description: It seems that X is getting ready to finally roll out the payments app the company‚Äôs leaders have long been promising The company will introduce X Money later this year with Visa as partner, CEO Linda Yaccarino announced.According to Yaccarino, X Money will support person-to-person payments via users‚Äô debit cards with the ability to transfer funds to a bank account, much like Venmo. The service will also allow you to deposit money into an ‚ÄúX Wallet.‚ÄùAnother milestone for the Everything App: @Visa is our first partner for the @XMoney Account, which will debut later this year.üí∞Allows for secure + instant funding to your X Wallet via Visa Direct ü™™ Connects to your debit card allowing P2P paymentsüè¶ Option to instantly...‚Äî Linda Yaccarino (@lindayaX) January 28, 2025 Bothe Yaccarino and X owner Elon Musk have long promised to bring financial services to X as they attempt to turn the platform into an ‚Äúeverything app.‚Äù In a memo last year, Yaccarino said the company planned to support banking and payments features for users. Musk has also said he wants people to be able to run their ‚Äúentire financial world‚Äù via X.So far, X Money sounds like it‚Äôs a long way off from that vision, though Yaccarino said the Visa partnership is the ‚Äúfirst of many big announcements about X Money this year.‚Äù X hasn‚Äôt disclosed specifics about how X Money will work for users or how it might make money off the service. X‚Äôs business is reportedly struggling. Musk recently told employees that ‚Äúour user growth is stagnant, revenue is unimpressive, and we‚Äôre barely breaking even,‚Äù in a memo reported by The Wall Street Journal.This article originally appeared on Engadget at https://www.engadget.com/social-media/xs-payments-app-will-be-available-later-this-year-181046773.html?src=rss

articles.title: Apple and the art of IT management
articles.description: They may be stressed about shadow IT, security, endpoint management, and the recent proliferation of artificial intelligence (AI) tools. They‚Äôre challenged not just by static budgets and rising costs, but by the proliferation of tools they now must use to do their job. And while IT admins are not exactly struggling for work, there is plenty for them to do.Those are some of the findings in JumpCloud‚Äôs latest survey of IT admin decision-makers across the US, UK, and Australia. The report confirms that the workplace continues to become increasingly multi-platform, with 27% of enterprise employees now preferring to use Macs, up from low-single figures at the turn of the century.JumpCloud, which this week acquired Stack Identity, is one of the larger unified device, identity, and access management platforms to provide support for the burgeoning Apple enterprise.Windows down, macOS and Linux up‚ÄúWindows use has shown the most significant decrease over the last six months, compared to macOS and Linux, which both increased,‚Äù said JumpCloud. When asked about the breakdown of their organization‚Äôs device type, admins reported Windows devices comprise 56% (down from 63% in Q3 2024), macOS 27% (up from 24% in Q3 2024), and Linux 20% (up from 18% in Q3 2024).Mac adoption in the enterprise is certain to continue to climb. The tech support cost overhead of managing Windows systems means a migration might represent low-hanging fruit for many enterprise leaders working to squeeze more from their budgets. Initial cost aside (and the difference between Mac and equivalent Windows systems is smaller now than ever), the total cost of ownership has a significant impact on budgets.Make no mistake. Budget-wrangling really is a thing: 39% spend up to half of their entire budget on licensing fees. While this reflects the grim reality that tech providers of all kinds are forcing subscriptions onto their customers, it represents a massive increase in such costs. In Q3, 2024 just 28% of admins endured similar budget erosion for licensing fees. What do you get for your money?Windows and other Microsoft devices were seen as the most difficult things to manage by 23% of respondents. To be fair, Apple devices were seen as difficult to manage by 19% of IT admins, with Linux winning unspoken praise ‚Äî just 14% of admins saw it as the most difficult.All the same, what that difference in Windows-vs-Mac management difficulty means is that the Windows experience is more abrasive, which ‚Äî in conjunction with the upcoming Windows licensing replacement cycle ‚Äî means IT will be tempted to look at alternatives.Perhaps that‚Äôs why 43% of admins expect macOS device use to increase in the coming year, though 54% also anticipate increased use of Windows. The default rate ‚Äî enterprises dropping support for either platform ‚Äî is fairly equal, though Apple has the edge. On-prem, off-prem, and multicloudAdmins are also frustrated at the complexity of managing cloud and multi-cloud setups. That‚Äôs turning into a big opportunity for managed service providers (MSPs) who increasingly offer to ease the pain of managing multi-cloud setups. MSPs aren‚Äôt just about cloud services management, of course. But it does appear to be their time to shine, with 93% of organizations already using or considering an MSP. Their role also seems to be changing, as they‚Äôre increasingly seen as trusted advisors.Can AI supplement IT roles? Admins see the technology as both a risk and an opportunity. But organizations appear to be accelerating AI deployments, with 15% of admins warning the tech is being put in place too fast and 67% believing these deployments are outpacing organizational ability to protect against threats.‚ÄúKeeping pace with all the improvements and changes keeps me up at night,‚Äù one anonymous survey respondent told JumpCloud. ‚ÄúAI has bought a new way of doing business and requires major adjustments.‚Äù Back to the (AI) futureIt‚Äôs not just deployment that has admins spooked. Thirty-seven percent of them fear AI will take their jobs ‚Äî and 56% of corporate vice presidents now worry AI will replace them, up from 29% a year ago. All the same, fear of redundancy is endemic across every role.How is AI being managed? Most enterprises are taking steps to accommodate its use, with just 21% having taken no steps or put AI restrictions in position. Almost half (49%) of companies have developed policies to guide employee use of AI, with 47% encouraging use of tools such as ChatGPT. With data being the new gold, it‚Äôs no surprise that 28% of IT admins said their companies now have controls in place to prevent employee use of AI. ‚ÄúTo harness [AI‚Äôs] power responsibly, organizations must lead with clear governance and innovation frameworks that balance opportunity with risk,‚Äù JumpCloud said.All the same, unauthorized use of AI continues, and just like any other form of Shadow IT this proliferation is a big problem for IT. The usual suspectsThe number of admins concerned about the use of apps and devices that aren‚Äôt managed has increased again, with 88% of IT admins now worried about this. They estimate that most employees use between one and five unauthorized applications.There are lots of reasons for this, one of them being the speed at which businesses are moving, which means the current needs aren‚Äôt being met, driving employees to seek solutions that fit. And while you‚Äôd expect IT to spend time handling this, lack of time and lack of visibility into all the apps employees use means that just as fiscal budgets demand careful juggling, so too does precious IT time.What else is eating that time? Security. It currently consumes the lion‚Äôs share of IT budgets. A plurality of organizations (47%) spend between 10% and 25% of their yearly IT budget on cybersecurity; another 24% spend 26% to 50%; 5% spend more than half their budget on security; and 24% less than 9% on security. In other words, security remains a tidy little earner for vendors, and a significant revenue expenditure line item for IT. You‚Äôd think with all that money spent, security would already be tightly constrained, but that‚Äôs not the case. Almost half (46%) of organizations report that they have fallen victim to a cyberattack. AI-augmented attacks are also proliferating ‚Äî this is now the third-biggest security concern after phishing and shadow IT. Man-in-the-middle attacks, MFA hacks and security breaches in partner organizations are also on the rise.In other words, security is an endless feast of fear for some, and of revenue for others. Of course, things might be better if there were platform choices that could mitigate this attack surface.You can explore some of the highlights from a previous JumpCloud survey here.You can follow me on social media! Join me on BlueSky, LinkedIn, Mastodon, and MeWe.

articles.title: IND vs ENG, 3rd T20I: Netizens troll Harry Brook over dismissal, ask 'smog again in Rajkot?'
articles.description: England vice-captain Harry Brook has yet again failed to deliver in the ongoing T20I series against India as he was dismissed cheaply in the third T20I at the Niranjan Shah Stadium in Rajkot on Tuesday, January 28. Brook walked out to bat when England were 83/2 after skipper Jos Buttler‚Äôs dismissal. However, the right-hander didn‚Äôt stay at the crease for too long as he was bowled by Ravi Bishnoi for 8 at 108/4. In the last match in Chennai, Harry Brook was dismissed in a similar fashion by Indian spinner Varun Chakravarthy for 13 runs. After England‚Äôs defeat in the opening match of the T20I series against England at the Eden Gardens Stadium, Harry Brook blamed the Kolkata‚Äôs smog for England‚Äôs batters‚Äô struggle against spin bowling. Given his comments after England's defeat in the first T20I in Kolkata, Harry Brook was brutally trolled by the Indian cricket fans on social media, especially on X (formerly Twitter). The netizens reminded Brook of his poor form throughout the series and sarcastically linked his struggle against spin to ‚Äòsmog‚Äô, mocking his earlier excuse in Kolkata. The fans posted hilarious memes and tweets, pointing out that Brook‚Äôs struggles had little to do with the extra conditions. articles.title: Six Months, 36 Meetings: Inside JPC‚Äôs deliberation on WAQF Bill amendments; To be presented in parliament soon
creator: WEB DESK
articles.description: The Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) has cleared the WAQF Bill 1995 with 25 amendments across 14 clauses/sections, according to JPC Chairman Jagdambika Pal. In his statement, Pal defended the process and outlined the extensive efforts made by the committee to involve various stakeholders over the past six months. He said, ‚ÄúThe way we had a democratic meeting yesterday, and the amendment that the government passed in the WAQF 1995 bill, that amendment was referred to the JPC, in which for the past six months, we have continuously visited states, be it Maharashtra, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Telangana, Odisha, Assam, West Bengal, Bihar, UP, we had 36 meetings in Delhi, and we met with all stakeholders, state government officials, work board, SHIA WAQF board, Sunni WAQF board, minority commissions, Islamic scholars, professors, retired judges, lawyers, high courts, Supreme Court, we met with everyone.‚Äù He continued, ‚ÄúNow, the meeting that was held yesterday, on those 44 clauses or amendments, we had asked for an amendment from the parties because that is a process, so amendments had come in that, and we have given the opportunity to present each amendment to all the members.‚Äù Addressing the criticisms from opposition members, Pal stated, ‚ÄúToday, the allegations that are being put, whether it is Kalyan Banerjee, or whether it is A Raja, or whether it is someone else, we have given them the opportunity to speak, we have asked them to present each amendment.‚Äù Further explaining the voting process, he said, ‚ÄúThen, when there is no agreement on the amendment among the members, there is voting on it, this is a process, and on each of their proposals, we have done voting on the amendment, and in which the voting has been recorded, there is a photograph of it, that on their proposals, they got 10 votes in their favour, and 16 went against them.‚Äù Pal pressed upon the role of majority vote in the decision-making process, stating, ‚ÄúWhether it is within the parliament, or whether it is a standing committee of the parliament, or whether it is a joint parliamentary committee, it will be decided from the vote of any party, on the basis of majority, whether the amendment is adopted or not.‚Äù Pal assured the public of the transparency of the process, ‚ÄúIt was done in a transparent and democratic way, and on all the clauses, whether it was on any member of the opposition, we have done voting on them, and the result that came out, we have declared it clause by clause every time, and our secretary has recorded.‚Äù He further confirmed he will present the bill to the members of JPC, ‚ÄúTomorrow, again in Delhi, we will have our adoption meeting, in which we will present this bill to the members of the joint parliamentary committee, and then we will adopt it. And after that, we will present our JPC report, which is about 500 pages long, we will adopt that report as well. After that adoption, we will request the speaker that we want to present our report.‚Äù (With inputs from ANI)

articles.title: Mithila Palkar lifts a 35 kg camera for Sweet Dreams; actress says, "No bruises fortunately, but it was heavy"
articles.description: What if your dreams held the key to a connection you never imagined? Disney+ Hotstar, in collaboration with Jio Studios and Mango People Media, has taken audiences on a one-of-a-kind journey with Sweet Dreams, now streaming on the platform. Directed by visionary filmmaker Victor Mukherjee, the film tells an extraordinary tale of two strangers linked by the surreal world of dreams. Featuring a star-studded cast that includes Mithila Palkar, Amol Parashar, Meiyang Chang, and Sauraseni Maitra, Sweet Dreams comes alive under the expert production of Jyoti Deshpande, Neha Anand, and Pranjal Khandhdiya. The film‚Äôs soulful soundtrack, crafted by Mukund Suryawanshi, Shubham Shirule, Dev Arijit, and Akashdeep Sengupta, perfectly complements its whimsical tone.Mithila Palkar, widely loved for her relatable girl-next-door roles, has captivated audiences once again with her performance in Sweet Dreams. The actress has been receiving praise for portraying a character that resonates deeply with today‚Äôs generation. However, Mithila didn‚Äôt just stop at acting this time‚Äîshe decided to hone her skills behind the camera as well.In a fun yet challenging moment during the shoot, Mithila took it upon herself to lift a 35 kg film camera and shoot a sequence for the movie. Reflecting on the experience, Mithila shared, ‚ÄúBeing in front of the camera is always a blessing, but this time it wasn‚Äôt a scene. Yes, it was 35 kg, and it wasn‚Äôt as easy as it looked. No bruises fortunately, but it was heavy! I wanted to feel the weight of the equipment that creates magic because I was fascinated and wanted to give it a shot. Honestly, I‚Äôve tried lifting cameras on every set I‚Äôve been on. But the weight of this camera was heavier than I had lifted. This experience also reminded me of the immense gratitude we owe to the people who work tirelessly behind the scenes, lifting equipment and making us look great on screen."As Sweet Dreams continues to enchant viewers, it offers an unforgettable cinematic experience full of magic, emotions, and heartfelt performances. If you haven‚Äôt already, grab your popcorn and immerse yourself in this beautiful tale titled Sweet Dreams, now streaming exclusively on Disney+ Hotstar.Also Read: Amol Parashar talks about Sweet Dreams co-star Mithila Palkar; says, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve always wanted to collaborate on a romantic film‚Äù

articles.title: Boman Irani shares the sweetest anniversary post for wife Zenobia Irani
articles.description: Boman Irani, who is known for several character roles over the years, shared a special moment from his life on social media recently. The actor completed 40 years of marriage and shared the sweetest post for his wife Zenobia along with a collage of the celebrations. Meanwhile, the post received much love from fans and followers on the platform which also included industry insiders like Farah Khan and Cyrus Broacha.Boman Irani took to his Instagram page to share a collage of their cute poses with each other where the couple were seen dressed in casual clothes, with a tikka on their foreheads, as they were seen holding red ‚ÄòI Followed by the post, Farah Khan Kunder, who also made her acting debut with Irani commented on it saying, ‚ÄúHappy anniversary you 2. Could hav bn me bomzi if only u had waited‚Äù. Along with her, other celebrities like Maria Gorettiz, Divya Dutta, Cyrus Broacha, Saba Pataudi, Vrajesh Hirjee, and others also dropped their best wishes. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Boman Irani (@boman_irani)Meanwhile, coming to his work commitments, the actor is currently busy with his directorial debut The Mehta Boys, which explores the intricacies and complications of a father-son relationship. The film, also starring Avinash Tiwary, will premiere on Amazon Prime Video, on February 7.Also Read: Prime Video set to premiere Boman Irani‚Äôs directorial debut The Mehta Boys on this date

articles.title: Sharvari spreads joy at the Dadar flower market with photographer Sutej Pannu
articles.description: Photographer Sutej Singh Pannu, known globally for his heartwarming images, met Sharvari at Mumbai‚Äôs iconic Dadar flower market to spread some joy amongst flower vendors in the early hours of the morning. Together, they embarked on a journey to make the day memorable for these vendors. For the unversed, Sharvari is a resident of the area is quite well-versed with the surroundings.Amid the colorful chaos of the flower market, Sharvari embraced the bustling energy, engaging warmly with flower vendors. She picked up a camera herself, capturing portraits of the vendors in their element, considering how she loves photography. The actress was seen sharing some jokes and fun banter with the locals and flower sellers, as the latter too chatted happily with the Munjya star. In the video, Sutej even asked Sharvari a question, ‚ÄúYou brought smiles to their faces, how did you feel?‚Äù Sharvari replied with a heartfelt smile, ‚ÄúI felt very happy. These pure moments are very special and making them smile made my day.‚Äù At the end of the video, Sutej also presented Sharvari with a photo he took of her at the Dadar flower market, as a memento of this beautiful moment.The photographer also penned this whole caption on his Instagram post, wherein he wrote, ‚ÄúThe path of inner healing opens a portal to eternal creative energy. As you align with your true self, the urge to create flows naturally through your being. The journey of inner mastery is the journey of aligning with your divine artist. By unlearning self-sabotaging mind patterns, you become more receptive to untapped potential and inspired ideas. When your purpose aligns with your sacred gifts, creation becomes an offering to existence itself. Anything born from this space of purity carries a soulful, healing impact‚Äîone that resonates across time, touching hearts for generations to come.‚Äù View this post on Instagram A post shared by Sutej Singh Pannu (@sutejpannu)On the work front, Sharvari is currently gearing up for the release of the action-spy thriller Alpha, co-starring Alia Bhatt along with Hrithik Roshan in a cameo.Also Read: Sharvari shines at Sabyasachi‚Äôs 25th anniversary celebration in a black and gold Sabyasachi saree

articles.title: Priyanka Gandhi Visits Kin Of Tribal Woman Who Died In Tiger Attack In Wayanad ‚Äî Video
creator: ABP News Bureau
articles.description: Wayanad MP Priyanka Gandhi on Tuesday met the kin of the woman who died in a tiger attack in Wayanad. The Congress leader travelled to Wayanad by road after arriving at Kannur International Airport on Tuesday. Priyanka Gandhi met the bereaved family members to express her condolences and offer support to the family of Radha. On January 24, a tribal woman named Radha was fatally attacked by a man-eating tiger near a coffee plantation. Hours after the incident, Priyanka Gandhi took to X and said, "I am deeply saddened by the tragic loss of Smt. Radha, who was killed by a tiger while harvesting coffee in Pancharakolly, Mananthavady. My heartfelt condolences to her family. There is an immediate need for sustainable solutions to address this pressing issue."VIDEO | Kerala: Wayanad MP Priyanka Gandhi (@priyankagandhi) visits family of Radha who was killed in a tiger attack. #Wayanad #Tigerattack pic.twitter.com/StKD2lK8kt‚Äî Press Trust of India (@PTI_News) January 28, 2025 ALSO READ: Telangana: Dalit Man Found Dead Months After Intercaste Marriage. Wife Accuses Her Family Of 'Dishonour Killing'Additionally, Priyanka Gandhi is likely to meet the family of NM Vijayan, a former Congress worker who died by suicide in Wayanad. Vijayan reportedly ended his life due to severe debts incurred after allegedly collecting money from job seekers for positions at a Congress-controlled cooperative bank. Recently, Sulthan Bathery MLA IC Balakrishnan was arrested for abetment in the alleged suicide of party treasurer NM Vijayan and his son. The allegations point that IC Balakrishnan instructed Vijayan to collect the funds.Priyanka Gandhi's visit highlights the Congress party's efforts to address the grievances of affected families and provide solace amid growing concerns over these incidents.(More details awaited)

articles.title: DA hike alert: Jammu and Kashmir govt confirms 3% increase for employees and pensioners
articles.description: The government is about to make a great decision. At the beginning of the year, the state government employees (government employees) got great news. Putting an end to all expectations, the state government decided to increase everyone's Dearness Allowance (Dearness Allowance). Finally the wait is over. The state government has decided to increase the Dearness Allowance (Dearness Allowance). Not 10 percent, this time the dearness allowance is being increased by 3 percent. Lakhs of government employees of the state will be benefited due to this announcement by the government. Many pensioners will also benefit. If you are a government employee, keep an eye on today's report for details. The directive states that government employees working under the recommendations of the Seventh Pay Commission will now get 53 percent DA of their basic pay. It is to be noted that earlier the dearness allowance rate was 50 percent. The government directive further states that the arrears of additional DA installments from July 2024 to December 2024 will be paid to everyone in February 2025. Along with this, the monthly salary of January 2025 will also include increased DA. Naturally, this decision of the government has brought smiles to the faces of lakhs of government employees and pensioners. According to another order issued by the Finance Department, the DA of pensioners and family pensioners has been increased from 50 percent to 53 percent of their basic pension or basic family pension. The revised rates will be reflected in pensions and family pensions starting from January 2025. If you think that the dearness allowance of Bengal government employees has been increased, then you are thinking wrong. Actually, the Jammu and Kashmir government has decided to increase DA. The first elected government of the Union Territory has increased the Dearness Allowance (DA) for its employees and pensioners to 53 percent. A guideline has already been issued to this effect.

articles.title: Sanatan Dharma Row: Supreme Court Refuses To Entertain Pleas Against Tamil Nadu Deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin
creator: IANS
articles.description: The Supreme Court on Monday refused to entertain pleas seeking legal action, including registration of an FIR, against Tamil Nadu Deputy CM Udhayanidhi Stalin over his controversial statements on 'Sanatan Dharma'. Speaking at a conference in Chennai in September 2023, the then minister for sports and youth affairs had said, "Sanatana Dharma was against social justice and equality and that it should be 'eradicated' like malaria and dengue."A bench of Justices Bela M. Trivedi and P.B. Varale questioned the maintainability of writ petitions filed under Article 32 of the Constitution.Sending the disclination of the apex court to entertain the plea, senior advocate Dama Seshadri Naidu, appearing for B. Jagannath and two other petitioners, sought permission to withdraw the pleas.Ultimately, the petition was dismissed as withdrawn with the liberty to avail remedies available under the law.The Supreme Court is also seized of a plea filed by Stalin Jr seeking directions to consolidate various FIRs and complaints lodged against him over his controversial statements.Agreeing to examine the plea, a bench presided over by Justice Sanjiv Khanna (now CJI) sought responses from various state governments in the matter.The plea had contended that the DMK leader has been receiving threats to his life and will encounter great difficulty in appearing before different police stations and courts in different regions.Udhayanidhi Stalin had spoken at a function of Tamil Nadu Progressive Writers on the Sanatan Dharma, saying that it was against social justice. He also said that Sanatan Dharma must be eradicated like mosquitoes, dengue, malaria or corona.The Tamil Nadu minister for sports and youth affairs had said, ‚ÄúIt (Sanatan Dharma) has to be eradicated, rather than opposing it.‚Äù Later, he refused to apologise for his remarks and justified himself by stating: ‚ÄúI will say this continuously.‚ÄùEarlier, the top court had said that it would not entertain a plea seeking contempt action against Stalin Jr over his controversial statements saying that it would be ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù to hear individual cases across the country.‚ÄúIf we start entertaining contempt, we will be flooded with it. We will not go into individual cases,‚Äù it had said.(This report has been published as part of the auto-generated syndicate wire feed. Apart from the headline, no editing has been done in the copy by ABP Live.)

articles.description: President Donald Trump's brash populism has always involved incongruence: the billionaire businessman-politician stirring the passions of millions who, regardless of the US economy's trajectory, could never afford to live in his Manhattan skyscraper or visit his club in south Florida.His second White House is looking a lot like the inside of Mar-a-Lago, with extremely wealthy Americans taking key roles in his administration.The world's richest man, Elon Musk, is overseeing a new Department of Government Efficiency. articles.title: Business News | Leveraging Technology for Better Public Infrastructure Maintenance
articles.description: Get latest articles and stories on Business at LatestLY. New Delhi [India], January 28: Public infrastructure serves as the backbone of any thriving community, facilitating mobility, connectivity, and access to essential services. Its effective maintenance is critical to ensuring the smooth operation of society and fostering economic growth. Yet, municipalities around the globe are grappling with a myriad of challenges in keeping infrastructure assets in optimal condition. Aging systems, inefficient practices, escalating costs, and mismanagement often lead to delays, resource wastage, and public dissatisfaction. As cities and governments strive for resilience and sustainability, technology has emerged as a transformative force, offering innovative solutions to address these pressing issues.

articles.title: Trump vows tariffs on nations that 'harm' US; names India, China, Brazil
articles.description: The United States will impose tariffs on the countries that "harm" America, President Donald Trump has said, as he named China, India and Brazil as high-tariff countries.We're going to put tariffs on outside countries and outside people that really mean harm to us. Well, they mean us harm, but they basically want to make their country good, Trump told House Republicans at a Florida retreat on Monday, the first after he became the president for the second term last week.Look at what others do. China is a tremendous tariff maker, and India and Brazil and so many other countries. So we're not going to let that happen any longer because we're going to put America first, he said.He said that the US will establish a "very fair system where money is going to come into our coffers and America is going to be very rich again", adding that it will happen "very quickly".Trump underscored that it was time for the US to return to the system that made it "richer and more powerful than ever ..

articles.title: Donald Trump warns on China‚Äôs Rising AI power, calls DeepSeek a ‚Äòwake-up call‚Äô for US
articles.description: US President Donald Trump has sounded the alarm on China's rising AI prowess, calling the emergence of DeepSeek, a low-cost AI model, a "wake-up call" for American industries. This comes after a sharp decline in US tech stocks, with Nvidia, the dominant AI semiconductor maker, losing nearly $600 billion in market value. Speaking at a Republican congressional retreat in Miami, Trump emphasized the need for the US to refocus on competing the AI sector, which is evolving at a rapid pace. He noted that DeepSeek's success could push Silicon Valley to innovate more efficiently, potentially leading to breakthroughs without the hefty price tag. "Instead of spending billions and billions, you'll spend less, and you'll come up with hopefully the same solution," Trump said. DeepSeek was developed by a startup in Hangzhou at a fraction of the investment of leading US AI models and has reportedly matched their performance. This underscores China's growing competitiveness in artificial intelligence, a field historically dominated by the US. To address the rising competition, Trump unveiled a $500 billion initiative last week to bolster AI infrastructure in the US. This venture, led by SoftBank and OpenAI, aims to strengthen America's position in the global AI race. The implications of China's AI advancements have sparked concerns about the US losing its edge. The launch of DeepSeek now increases the intensifying competition between the US and China, especially in AI technology.

articles.title: LinkedIn's founder optimistic about AI, hopes peers are right about Trump
articles.description: LinkedIn founder Reid Hoffman has been immersed in Silicon Valley since his August 1967 birth in Palo Alto, California, in the shadow of Stanford University, where he and fellow technology luminary Peter Thiel became friends as college students during the 1980s.They went on to start PayPal during the late 1990s while working alongside a coterie of other bright-eyed entrepreneurs who went on to even bigger things, just as Hoffman did. That group dubbed the PayPal Mafia included Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Yelp CEO Jeremy Stoppelman, and YouTube co-founders Chad Hurley and Steve Chen.Now worth an estimated $2.6 billion, Hoffman has been at the forefront of the artificial intelligence craze while investing in trailblazing startups such as ChatGPT maker OpenAI and Inflection. Unlike other prominent technologists who are worried about AI destroying humanity, Hoffman has co-written a new book called Superagency that makes an optimistic case for AI. articles.description: BJP and allies have cleared significant amendments to the Waqf Act, ending the 'waqf by user' scheme. These measures aim to tackle misuse and corruption, with the bill expected to be passed in Parliament.

articles.title: Google open-sources the Pebble smartwatch‚Äôs software, and its creator is making a new model
creator: Will Shanklin
articles.description: Pebble is back, baby. On Monday, Google (which owns Pebble‚Äôs IP via its Fitbit purchase) open-sourced the OG modern smartwatch‚Äôs software. Although that paves the road for anyone to make new Pebble-esque wearables (or custom firmware for the old models), one high-profile figure has already raised his hand: Pebble creator Eric Migicovsky.Google says the open-source PebbleOS includes most of the software‚Äôs source code. The only exceptions are proprietary code for chipset and Bluetooth software. Google‚Äôs Matthieu Jeanson, Katharine Berry and Liam McLoughlin wrote that developers face ‚Äúa non-trivial amount of work‚Äù in finding replacements for the stripped-out pieces of code. Migicovsky says he spurred the project by asking friends at Google if they would open-source the software.The Pebble founder, who went on to run Beeper (the iMessage for Android app that sparked a short-lived war with Apple), wrote on his blog that he wants his planned smartwatch to be a modern take on the original Pebble ‚Äî a spiritual successor that doesn‚Äôt try to reinvent the wheel. ‚ÄúNo one makes a smartwatch with the core set of features I want,‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúI had really, really, really hoped that someone else would come along and build a Pebble replacement. But no one has.‚ÄùKickstarterHis wishlist for the as-yet-unnamed product includes an always-on e-paper screen, long battery life, a ‚Äúsimple and beautiful user experience,‚Äù physical buttons and hackability (like custom watch faces). Those were indeed the hallmarks of the innovative and charming Pebble, which broke Kickstarter records and preceded Apple, Samsung and Google‚Äôs models by several years.‚ÄúThe new watch we‚Äôre building basically has the same specs and features as Pebble, though with some fun new stuff as well,‚Äù the Pebble founder wrote, adding that his team still needs to nail down the product‚Äôs exact specifications and timeline. ‚ÄúIt runs open source PebbleOS, and it‚Äôs compatible with all Pebble apps and watchfaces.‚ÄùDevelopers can get Google‚Äôs open-sourced Pebble OS on GitHub. And if you‚Äôre interested in Migicovsky‚Äôs as-yet-unnamed spiritual successor to the 2013 smartwatch, you can sign up for updates on its webpage.This article originally appeared on Engadget at https://www.engadget.com/wearables/google-open-sources-the-pebble-smartwatchs-software-and-its-creator-is-making-a-new-model-220526568.html?src=rss
